text.p: In the four weeks beginning from now, the lab assistant named Welt will be bearing a heavy responsibility. Lab 42 is now on a “quasi-holiday” because the supercomputer Ada has been shackled with a computationally-heavy task — which means that Welt needs to organise the entertainment and recreational activities of the two doctors for every day during the entire period. Although one of the doctors would proclaim that “Just because we're on vacation, doesn't mean we don't need to work some days”; given the personality of the other, it seems difficult to say …

scene.text: Especially given that just a few hours ago, his own foolhardy behaviour had caused her to blow a fuse.

The wall clock silently ticks past eleven o'clock. Despite knowing that the law and order in this neighbourhood is one of the best in the UK, Welt remains uneasy, and since he has difficulty sleeping anyway, chooses to stay up all night in the lobby.
On the other hand, Einstein, who seems accustomed to her roommate's late-night adventures, had already gone upstairs to “rest” an hour ago.
— If not for the various sounds of falling debris in the garbage chute, occurring from time to time. It sounds like someone is cleaning up the house.
After drinking his seventh cup of black tea, the “Catcher in the Rye” in his hand has already been flipped to its last page.

remark.p: “The Catcher in the Rye” is a novel published by American writer JD Salinger in 1951.

When it was first published, many schools and libraries banned the book; but now, this book is a designated reading for many American schools. Some critics say that it “has greatly affected generations of American youth.”

scene.text: The silly protagonist of the book had an amusing temperament, and this reminded him of “Don Quixote” he had read last year.
Ah.
Speaking of which …
Just now he had personally received a letter, and it was a very strange letter indeed …

text.p: Ω:
When you do receive this letter, it should already be around the 31st.
Happy Halloween.

I heard that, because a certain Overseer pays special attention to this festival, I've had to make grand arrangements at Headquarters every year … Yes, the attached photo shows the state of my preparations for this year.
By the way, something else to “celebrate”: starting this month, this lab's staff has been reduced to just me alone — so as you can see, even when taking a photo, I can only take one of myself.

I haven’t heard from you recently. Is it because of the new opportunities that have rekindled your passion for life? I've heard you guys have been travelling back and forth between the Atlantic Ocean, and have been having a great time. However, the North American branch has always been rated poorly by Headquarters. If they happen to cause some sort of trouble amongst themselves, or be at loggerheads with each other, you mustn't blindly participate … I've heard that still water runs deep, and thing can get rather treacherous.

… But I'm also being stupid. When the Gods fight, what does it ever have to do with mere mortals like you and me? Best not talk about it any more. Now, I don't know what the weather is like in London — but the moonlight in Vienna tonight is indeed hard to come by; I will thus borrow the power of alcohol, and guide us to chat about things that we usually cannot talk about. Well, it's a letter, so just let me talk, and you can just listen — don't take any of this too seriously.

I know that you are a person who likes reading. But … have you ever thought about what has caused us human beings, in our struggle against the Honkai, to be repeatedly thwarted, to suffer loss after loss? After all, what flaws make us vulnerable to being preempted and defeated by the Honkai, to the point of being close to surrender, too tired to cope anymore?
In other words … why do we always, always, always repeat the same mistakes?

It is true that, throughout human history, we have been steadily progressing, and this trend of progress will unlikely be obstructed by any trivial event or matter; but what I've been seeing more, are those pioneers who stand on the crest of the wave — isolated and cut off from help, battered and bruised, caught between a rock and a hard place. Sometimes, they may even lose, defeated and embarrassed by their own human foibles. Spiritually, they may be giants, but sometimes physically or materially they are weaklings; their spiritual strength often takes a long time to be passed down, before they become publicly recognised as priceless treasures.

Earlier, I told you the story of Saint Kallen. However, what I want to say today is … Compared to her great personality, nature instead granted her the body of an ordinary girl (although the bloodline of Kaslana is definitely nothing ordinary … but that won't make any difference to what I'm about to say here) — a body so weak and frail, one so minuscule and insignificant, that even the common folk can sentence her to death, so that even a lowly Honkai beast can take her life with ease.
Doesn't this make absolutely no sense?
The world we live in, it does not follow logic at all, and it does not respect the principle of equivalent exchange!
I will never forget what Kallen experienced during her short life.
I am convinced that, for us humans, the greatest enemy is not the Honkai at all, but ourselves.

— We are too weak, so weak that our heroes are always powerless to save everyone; we are too weak, so weak that some of us would even doubt the motives of our heroes; we are too weak, so weak that we will sacrifice true justice for a small immediate gain; we are too weak, so weak that we can only negotiate short-term peace amidst mutual conflict, and that we have to resort to official, pompous-sounding words like “social order” and “ethics” to cover up our despicable motives.

The Saint … She is a Saint because, despite being as fragile as us, she is very different from us, for she is one — just the one, the only one — who does not fear her vulnerability. This kind of bravery, emanating from the heart, is just like the sun to us ordinary folk — something we can all see, but can clearly never attain.
At least, compared to her … I am a complete coward.
Every one of us, harbouring this original sin called “fear”, trepidly seeks the answers to life's questions.
The Saint would never deride or jeer at us. But every time I realised that we are living like this, I would wish that I could kill myself with a single blow.

But imagine, if, if each of us really has a chance to rid ourselves of this fragility; if we can uproot this fear, this thought of “I am fragile” that is deeply rooted within our hearts … then we can create a new culture at that moment, one that is full of forgiveness, full of self-confidence, and full of vigour! And then the so-called “Honkai” before us, won't it then dwindle to something so small, so insignificant, as to be unworthy of mention?
Such a world, would protect its own Saints.
Such a world, is more worthy of protection from its Saints.
If, if, if there is ever a chance that Kallen is able to shine upon this world stage again, then, this time, she will not struggle to progress because of our own meagreness.

I haven't tasted red wine for a long time, but I have really been drinking quite a bit today. In your opinion, this letter may be pure unintelligible, incoherent rambling to you … but this doesn't matter. Before, I had been talking to you as a member of the organisation; today, let me be an ordinary researcher, and let me have a casual, self-opinionated rant for once.
I don't think the kind of world I have just imagined can be realised … but it doesn't matter. We still have a lot to do — don't we?
Your old friend, who has been a little strange today,
Clown Alpha

scene.text: 挂钟的时针转过了60°, 早已是第二天的凌晨了.
瓦尔特默默地给自己续上了第八杯红茶.
咔嗒.
咔嗒咔嗒.
咔嗒咔嗒咔嗒.
门外终于响起了醉鬼特有的, 那种死活也找不到锁眼的捅锁声.

scene.speak: 啊 … 你小子 … 没睡啊.
scene.text: 虚浮的脚步, 满脸的酒气 — 毫无疑问, 这家伙已经喝高了.
scene.speak: … 是啊. 要上楼吗?
scene.text: 想起了天然卷的叮嘱, 青年决定以平常心应对这个场面.
scene.speak: 上楼? … 不要不要.
scene.text: 半解开双马尾的红发女子粗鲁地挥舞着双手.
scene.speak: 你 … 来陪我说话.
… 我、我吗?
少 … 少废话!
除了你 … 还有谁 … 啊?

scene.text: 毫无酒品的“成年人”顺势一倒, 四仰八叉地躺在了身边的小沙发上.
scene.speak: … 反正你也没有听过不是吗?
没有听过?
呃 … 什么没有听过?
… 好啰嗦啊你. 哪里来的下院议员吗? 没有听过不就是没有听过吗?
… 本小姐难得一本正经地给你解释解释, 你洗好耳朵乖乖听着不就行了?
scene.text: 红发醉鬼一边无厘头地骂着, 一边厌恶地将自己的外套甩到了沙发靠背上.
scene.speak: … 你也知道, 老子的名字是尼古拉.
刚好在这边也算是个女孩子的名字, 所以就这么用了.
不过呐, 护照上可就 …
哈哈哈哈哈, 要说起来的话, 还有些羞耻呐.
呃 … 你是想说 …
… 尼古拉是假名吗?
倒也 … 算不上假名啦.
芙蕾德莉卡·尼古拉·特斯拉 … 全名算是这样的说.
真是的, 听起来跟个德国母猪似的.

remark.p: 特斯拉是一个出生在克罗地亚、拥有奥地利国籍的塞尔维亚族人. 在中东欧地区, 由于历史原因, 这样的情况并不少见.

scene.speak: 唉 … 不是个 … 很可爱的名字吗?
scene.text: 醉鬼不满地换了个姿势, 将两条腿交叉搭在了一起 —
scene.speak: 就知道你们男人要这么说.
尼古拉这种男女通用的名字, 你们就提不起“兴趣”了是不是?
呃 … 是、是这样吗 …
我已经受够了那种把我当所谓“女孩子”的生活.
scene.text: 醉鬼的语速陡然加快了起来 —
scene.speak: 简直傻得要死, 人类的个性哪里是靠性别啊、种族啊这种无聊的东西来定义的?
脑子被福尔马林泡过了吗?

remark.p: 福尔马林(Formalin)是甲醛含量约为40%, 甲醇含量含量约为15%的混合水溶液, 一般被用作制作标本的防腐剂.
在我们的世界中, 1955年4月18日, 物理学家阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦去世后7个小时内, 他的大脑就经由10% ~ 11.4%的福尔马林溶液初步固化, 而后被切片保存.

scene.speak: … 但确实, 很不幸, 世界上的绝大多数人真的只会作茧自缚, 用无聊的标签规划自己的生活.
一旦有人跳出了这些明明暗暗的“规则”, 他们就无名火起、暴跳如雷, 仿佛对方要毁了他们的人生似的.
这些人大概是忘了, 我们身上各种各样的身份, 不过是人类为了组织起一个像样的社会而虚构出来的设定.
所有自然界原本不存在的东西, 都不过是人类的虚构, 都不过是设定罢了.
虚、构、的!
天命是虚构的, 英国是虚构的, 靠左行驶是虚构的, 连厕所要分男女 — 那也是虚构的!
呃 …
啊 … 抱歉抱歉, 一股脑说这么多, 简直跟填鸭填鹅似的.

remark.p: 肥肝（法语: foie gras）是一道著名的法国菜, 在汉语常称“鹅肝”, 但实际上也有使用鸭肝来作为原材料的.
生产肥肝的农场会以管饲法将饲料直接强灌到胃部的方式来迫使鸭或鹅养成脂肪肝. 灌食为期2至4星期, 每日2至3次, 使用管子将特别调制的饲料浆直接灌入其食道. 这会使大量过剩的营养在其肝脏积聚, 最后得出肥大而细腻的脂肪肝.

scene.speak: 尼古拉·特斯拉, 人称“喝了酒秒变话痨”专业博士!
scene.text: 红发女子仰身跃起, 一把夺过了青年面前的红茶, 不由分说就喝了起来.
scene.speak: 你们所有人都管我叫博士 — 但我其实还没有毕业哦?
有那么吃惊吗 …
因为种种原因而选择休学退学的人也不少见吧.
可是 … 你在这里不也是做研究吗?
啊, 这个不一样啦.
scene.text: 特斯拉无奈的耸耸肩膀.
scene.speak: 普朗克教授是做纯理论的 — 凭我现在的研究, 可没法在她那里毕业.
尤其是爱因斯坦那个混蛋 … 最近只肯让我在艾妲上面跑虚拟测试了!
不就是炸了那么一两次卧室 … 至于吗?
啊.
你还不知道艾妲是谁吧?
… 艾妲的话, 今天倒是刚刚认识.
吼 — 看来你们已经把那玩意儿分析完了?
不 … 看起来要四周以后才能出结果.
唉 …
那今天晚上我们可以玩个通宵了吧! 哈哈哈哈哈!
通、通宵?
那不是当然吗 … 你个傻瓜!
四个星期耶!
整整一个月呐! 你懂吗? !
艾妲要忙那么久, 那我岂不是 … 放大假啦?
哈哈哈哈哈哈! 放假喽! 酒池肉林的生活! 我来啦!
还愣着干什么, 给姐姐我找酒来啊!
喂喂 … 你这 … 这、这不能再喝了吧?
都醉成这样了 … 还要喝? !
唉.
说什么傻话 … 我看是你自己喝多了吧 … 哈哈哈哈!
我这不还和你对答如流吗? 凭什么不能喝!
既然你不肯帮忙 …
… 那我就自己去拿呗?

scene.text: 说着, 她便晃晃悠悠地往楼上走去.
目标很明确 — 二层走廊尽头那台色彩鲜艳又圆滚滚的冰箱.
scene.speak: 啊 … 不行不行!
scene.text: 眼看无法阻止特斯拉的脚步, 瓦尔特把心一横, 冲上去紧紧拉住了她.
scene.speak: … 喂! 你干什么啦!
放开我的手!
如果你是要继续去喝酒的话, 那我是不会放开的.
scene.text: 青年再上前一步, 又拉住了她的另一只手.
scene.speak: 哈? 好不容易放个假, 怎么寻开心是我的自由吧?
喝两杯你也要管, 小气鬼!
scene.text: 醉鬼显然不会满意这种粗暴的干涉 — 她像拉面大师似的甩动着自己的双手, 试图从瓦尔特那里挣脱开来.
scene.speak: 喂!
变态! 色狼!
快放开啦!
你倒是放开啦放开啦放开啦!
… 那你能对自己的身体负责吗.
scene.text: 青年的脸上写满了哭笑不得 — 现在被他攥住双手的红发女孩子, 宛如一个得不到玩具的幼儿, 就差躺在地上撒泼耍赖了.
scene.speak: … 你不放开是不是.
在你放弃之前 … 我、我是不可能放开的!
你已经醉了, 回房休息吧.
不! 我没醉! 我明明这么精神!
… 只有醉鬼才会这么说吧!
没醉没醉就是没醉嘛!
scene.text: 特斯拉生气地蹲在地上 — 忽然又像想到了什么似的, 猛地跳了起来.
scene.speak: 我知道了. 我不喝酒了.
… 你别骗我.
不骗你不骗你!
scene.text: 这团散发着酒气的红毛露出了小恶魔一样的笑容.
scene.speak: 不过嘛, 作为代价 …
… 你要陪我玩!
陪我玩, 我就不喝!
真的真的! 不骗你的嘛!
… 好吧.
scene.text: 青年视死如归般点了点头 —
scene.speak: 所以, 你打算玩什么? 现在已经是深夜了吧?
哈哈哈哈, 就是深夜才好玩啊?
啊?
别、别说这种危险的发言啊喂!
听、听起来简直像是哪里的犯罪者一样好吗? !
啊. 害羞了害羞了.
什么害羞, 不要胡说!
我哪里害羞啦!
嘿嘿嘿嘿, 我就要说就要说!
瓦尔特! 你这个臭男人! 你有种就来 —

scene.text: 啪.
一只背后阴影中飞来的字典准确命中了这个聒噪家伙的脑袋.
scene.speak: 大半夜的吵死了!
都给我睡觉去! 现在! 马上!
瓦尔特, 你说 … 她为什么突然就一动不动了?
